project_overview.tagline: Threshold BLS network for verifiable random number generation
project_overview.description: ARPA Network is a threshold cryptography infrastructure providing Boneh-Lynn-Shacham (BLS) signature aggregation for secure, verifiable random number generation (VRG). The network's flagship product, Randcast, offers decentralized VRF (Verifiable Random Function) services for blockchain applications requiring unbiased randomness.

technology.description: ARPA Network implements threshold BLS (Boneh-Lynn-Shacham) signatures for distributed cryptographic operations. The network enables secure computation and verifiable random number generation through multiparty computation (MPC) and threshold signature schemes.
technology.privacy_mechanism: Threshold Cryptography, BLS Signatures, Secure Multi-Party Computation

key_innovations.description: Distributed signature generation using Boneh-Lynn-Shacham algorithm enabling threshold security
Verifiable Random Function service providing unbiased randomness for blockchain applications
key_innovations.note: Product mentioned in research gaps but not verified with primary sources

key_innovations.description: MPC protocol enabling distributed computation without revealing private inputs
key_innovations.note: Implied by threshold cryptography implementation, requires verification
